comments:
Open up the error log view and build a standard project with the makefile 
containing the line: g++ -c -I/my/include/path $^ -o $@

/my/include/path doesn't show up in the paths and symbols list. If you add the -
D option to the same line in the makefile, eg: -DDEBEG, and rebuild, then the 
include path will show up in the paths and symbols list.
Also if only the -D option is in the makefile and not the -I, then the symbol 
won't be found.

The error in the error log view is:

Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in: "org.eclipse.core.runtime".

definitions discovered.
